intro: [WRONG START] Embilia pyrifolia, commonly known as the Indian star anise, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, star-shaped fruits that resemble the spice star anise. The plant belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly aromatic scent. The fruit is used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent in some cuisines.
